text:
Hilda Isabel "Coca" Gorrindo Sarli (9 July 1929 – 25 June 2019) was an Argentine actress and glamour model. She is best known for starring in many sexploitation moviess by Armando Bó. Notable movies that Sarli appeared in that were directed by Bó include "Thunder Among the Leaves" (1958), "Carne" (1968), "Fuego" (1969) and "Fiebre" (1971). She began her career as a model and beauty queen. In 1955, she was named Miss Argentina and reaching the semi-finals of Miss Universe.
Sarli was born in Concordia, Entre Ríos. She was in a romantic relationship with Armando Bó until his death in 1981.
Sarli died on 25 June 2019 in Buenos Aires, at the age of 89.
